question: A 52-year-old woman presents with a palpable breast mass. Mammography reveals a 2.5 cm spiculated mass with microcalcifications. Core needle biopsy confirms invasive ductal carcinoma, ER positive, PR positive, HER2 negative. What is the most appropriate initial treatment?

options.A: Lumpectomy with sentinel lymph node biopsy followed by radiation
options.C: Mastectomy alone without lymph node evaluation

question: Which of the following molecular markers is most strongly associated with response to trastuzumab therapy in breast cancer?

options.C: HER2 (Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2) amplification

question: A 45-year-old woman with a strong family history of breast and ovarian cancer tests positive for a BRCA1 mutation. She has no current malignancy. Which of the following is the most effective risk-reduction strategy?

options.D: Increased physical activity and dietary modification

question: What is the primary mechanism of action of aromatase inhibitors in the treatment of postmenopausal breast cancer?

options.B: Inhibition of peripheral conversion of androgens to estrogens

question: A 38-year-old woman is diagnosed with inflammatory breast cancer. Which of the following clinical features is most characteristic of this condition?

options.B: Peau d'orange appearance with skin erythema and edema

question: Which histological subtype of breast cancer is most commonly associated with BRCA1 mutations?

A 60-year-old woman with metastatic ER-positive breast cancer has disease progression on tamoxifen and an aromatase inhibitor. Which of the following represents the next most appropriate treatment strategy?

options.A: Switch to a different aromatase inhibitor
options.B: Add a CDK4/6 inhibitor to hormonal therapy
options.D: Increase the dose of current aromatase inhibitor

question: What is the primary purpose of sentinel lymph node biopsy in early-stage breast cancer?

options.A: To determine the need for adjuvant systemic therapy
options.B: To stage the axilla and guide decisions about axillary lymph node dissection
options.C: To identify the primary site of distant metastases
options.D: To determine breast cancer molecular subtype

question: A 55-year-old woman presents with Paget disease of the nipple. What is the most likely underlying pathology?

options.B: Underlying ductal carcinoma in situ or invasive carcinoma

question: Which of the following factors is most strongly associated with an increased risk of developing breast cancer?

options.B: Multiparity with first pregnancy before age 20
